December 1918.r, CONTIOEXTiAL5^ALL GKv;:'I CIRCULATE the following for the consideration of the Cabinet.L W. E,LEAVE OR HOME SERVICE FOR 1914 MEN. I HAVE had many strong representations made on behalf of men in the old army who went abroad in 1914 that they should be sent back for a long leave or for home service. As an example, a married man went out in 1914, since when he has had ten days' and fourteen days' home leave, and this is now his fifth winter in France. I suggest that a public announcement should be made that such men should be given at least a month's leave, and that as many as possible should be transferred"to home service.L. W. E.December 1$, 1918.
